Alliance.Info: Die aktuelle Zugehörigkeit der Armee. Dies wird dadurch gesteuert, ob die Armee Spieler als Besitzer hat.
Alliance.Linked: Die Spielfiguren der Armee sind derzeit verbunden, Änderungen sollten sich korrekt durchziehen
Alliance.LinkError: Diese Armee kann nicht über eine Spielfigur verbunden werden. Gehe hierzu über den Akteur in der Seitenleiste und ziehe dann eine neue Kopie hinein.
Alliance.UnlinkedError: Armeen des Königreichs sollten verbundene Akteursdaten besitzen, damit sie korrekt funktionieren. Klicke hier, um die Verknüpfung zu aktivieren.

Error.InvalidTacticType: Die Taktik {name} wird von Armeen des Typs {type} nicht unterstützt

AdditionalWeapon.Name: Zusätzliche Bewaffnung
AdditionalWeapon.Description: Die meisten Armeen sind nur mit einer Waffe ausgestattet – einer Nah- oder Fernkampfwaffe. Diese Option rüstet eine Armee mit einer zusätzlichen Waffe der anderen Kategorie aus. Die Armee erhält dadurch einen Nah- oder Fernkampfangriff mit dem Grundmodifikator für ihre Stufe.

MagicWeapons.Name: Magische Waffen ({type})
MagicWeapons.Description: Die Armee verfügt über magische Waffen. Sollte die Armee über Nah- und Fernkampfwaffen verfügen, so bestimme bei Erwerb dieser Ausrüstung, welche Kategorie magisch ist. Du kannst diese Ausrüstung zweimal erwerben – einmal für Nahkampfwaffen und einmal für Fernkampfwaffen. Solltest du eine mächtigere Version erwerben, so ersetzt diese die vorherige; die RP-Kosten der neuen Version werden um die RP-Kosten der ersetzten Waffen reduziert.

rank1.Name: Magische Waffen
rank1.Description: Diese Waffen erhöhen den Angriffsmodifikator der Armee mit diesen Waffen um 1.

rank2.Name: Starke Magische Waffen
rank2.Description: Diese Waffen erhöhen den Angriffsmodifikator der Armee mit diesen Waffen um 2.

rank3.Name: Mächtige Magische Waffen
rank3.Description: Diese Waffen erhöhen den Angriffsmodifikator der Armee mit diesen Waffen um 3.

Potions.Name: Heiltränke
Potions.Description: Eine mit Heiltränken ausgestattete Armee (diese Regeln sind identisch, falls du die Armee stattdessen mit alchemistischen heilenden Elixieren ausstattest) kann als Teil jeder Handlung der Kategorie Manöver eine Anwendung des Trankes zu sich nehmen. Dadurch erlangt sie 1 TP zurück. Eine Armee kann maximal insgesamt 3 Anwendungen mit sich führen. Im Gegensatz zu Fernkampfmunition erneuern sich Heiltränke nicht nach einer Massenkampfbegegnung, sondern müssen neu erworben werden.

Armor.Name: Magische Rüstungen
Armor.Description: Magische Rüstungen sind so verzaubert, dass sie den Soldaten besseren Schutz bieten.

rank1.Name: Magische Rüstungen
rank1.Description: Diese Rüstung erhöht die RK der Armee um 1.

rank2.Name: Starke Magische Rüstungen
rank2.Description: Diese Rüstung erhöht die RK der Armee um 2.

rank3.Name: Mächtige Magische Rüstungen
rank3.Description: Diese Rüstung erhöht die RK der Armee um 3.

Army.Label: Armee

Potions.FullHP: TP der Armee sind bereits voll
Potions.Label: Tränke
Potions.UsedPotionContent: Die Armee hat +1 TP erhalten. Kann bei Handlungen der Kategorie Manöver genutzt werden.

Army.RoutedDescription: Die TP der Armee liegen unterhalb ihres Panikwerts!

Strikes.CurrentAmmo:
{current} /{max} Schüsse
Wird am Ende der Massenkampfbegegnung aufgefüllt
Strikes.None: Diese Armee besitzt keine Waffen: Füge im Bereich Ausrüstung eine Waffe hinzu.
Strikes.Label: Angriffe
Strikes.OutOfAmmo: Keine Schüsse für diese Massenkampfbegegnung übrig

PF2E.Kingmaker.GrantedBy: This feature has been granted by {granter} and cannot be deleted

KingdomBuilder.ActivationMessage: Reichgründung beginnen? Stelle sicher, dass deine Spieler bereit sind, bevor du fortfährst.

Missing.Charter: Wähle eine Charta um Verbesserungen auszuwählen.
Missing.Heartland: Wähle ein Kernland um Verbesserungen auszuwählen.
Missing.Government: Wähle eine Regierungsform um Verbesserungen auszuwählen.

KingdomBuilder.Title: Erstelle dein Königreich

CollectDialog.Title: Collect Resources
CollectDialog.Description: Roll {dice} resource dice and generate the following?
CollectDialog.Disclaimer: This will replace your current resource points (which should have been converted into experience points). Excess commodities will be lost. Only the game master can collect resources.

ImportDialog.Title: Import Activities
ImportDialog.Content: {added} activities will be added and {updated} activities will be updated: is this ok?

commerce.Description: When the kingdom generates revenue or makes trade agreements.
commerce.Step1: Collect Taxes: Can be performed once per Kingdom turn. If you don't attempt to Collect Taxes, you can instead attempt a DC 11 flat check; on a success, reduce Unrest by 1
commerce.Step2: Approve Expenses: You can draw upon funds to attempt the Improve Lifestyle activity or you can attempt a withdrawal using the Tap Treasury activity.
commerce.Step3: Tap Commodities: If your kingdom has any stockpiles of Commodities, you can attempt the Trade Commodities activity to bolster your RP for that turn.
commerce.Step4: Manage Trade Agreements: If you've established trade agreeements, you can attempt to Manage Trade Agreements.

leadership.Description: If your kingdom’s capital has a Castle, Palace, or Town Hall, each PC in a leadership role may attempt up to three Leadership activities. If your capital has none of these structures, each PC can take no more than two Leadership activities during this step. Unless an activity states otherwise, a leader cannot attempt the same Leadership activity more than once per Kingdom turn.

region.Description: The PC leaders can collectively attempt up to three Region activities.

civic.Description: The party may attempt one Civic activity for each of the kingdom's settlements.

army.Description: Nachdem die SC den Schritt Stadthandlungen im Rahmen des Reichzuges beendet haben, können sie den Schritt Armeehandlungen ausführen. Während dieses Schrittes kann jede aktuell vom Reich unterhaltene Armee eine einzelne Armeehandlung ausführen.

VacancyPenalty.ruler: -1 to all checks (this stacks with any other vacancy penalty); Gain 1d4 Unrest at the start of the Kingdom turn; Control DC increases by 2

food.Name: Farmland
food.Description: Reduces consumption during the Upkeep phase. Food needs to be gathered during the region phase using Harvest Crops, Go Fishing, or Gather Livestock. Created using Establish Farmland.

lumber.Name: Lumber Camps
lumber.Description: Increases Lumber gained during the Upkeep phase. Created using Establish Work Site.

luxuries.Name: Mines (Gem)
luxuries.Description: Very rare work site. Grants Luxuries during the Upkeep phase.

ore.Name: Mines
ore.Description: Increases Ore gained during the Upkeep phase. Created using Establish Work Site.

stone.Name: Quarries
stone.Description: Increases Stone gained during the Upkeep phase. Created using Establish Work Site.

WorkSites.Label: Work Sites
WorkSites.Resource: If a work site has been built on a dense or lucrative source for that material, mark it here instead. These produce double the usual amount.

conquest.Name: Conquest
conquest.Description: Your sponsors have conquered an area and its former leaders have been routed or even killed. This charter places you in charge of some portion of this conquered territory (or land abandoned by the defeated enemy) and commands you to hold and pacify it in the name of your patron. The people are particularly devoted and supportive of your rule (if partially out of fear), but the constant threat of potential war hinders the arts and makes it difficult for citizens to truly relax. If you opt for this charter, you are asked to set up your kingdom against Pitax

expansion.Name: Expansion
expansion.Description: Your patron places you in charge of a domain adjacent to already settled lands with the expectation that your nation will remain a strong ally. The greater support from your patron's nation helps to bolster your own kingdom's society, but this increased reliance means that fluctuations in your ally's fortunes can impede your own kingdom's security. If you select this charter, Lady Jamandi expects you to remain strong allies with Restov.

exploration.Name: Exploration
exploration.Description: Your sponsor wants you to explore, clear, and settle a wilderness area along the border of the sponsor's own territory. Your charter helps to secure initial structures (or supplies to create them), at the cost of incurring financial debt.

grant.Name: Grant
grant.Description: Your patron grants a large amount of funding and other resources without restriction on the nature of your kingdom's development, but they do require you to employ many of their citizens and allies. Your nation's wealth and supplies are secure, but a portion of your kingdom's residents have split allegiances between your nation and that of your sponsor.

open.Name: Open
open.Description: If you would prefer to be truly free agents and trailblazers staking your own claim, you can simply choose an open charter with no restrictions, and no direct support. In this case, Lady Jamandi applauds your bravery and self-confidence, but warns that establishing a kingdom is no small task. An open charter grants a single ability boost to any ability score, and the new nation has no built-in ability flaw.

forestOrSwamp.Name: Forest Or Swamp
forestOrSwamp.Description: Your nation begins in woodlands or swamplands, so there are no shortages in natural resources or wonders to bolster your citizens' imagination and mood.

hillOrPlain.Name: Hill or Plain
hillOrPlain.Description: Your nation starts in an area that is easy to traverse. This is reflected in your citizens' temperament; they appreciate that your choice makes their lives a bit easier.

lakeOrRiver.Name: Lake Or River
lakeOrRiver.Description: By establishing your nation on the shores of a lake or river, you ensure a built-in mechanism for trade. Even before a road is built, merchants and travelers can reach your settlement with relative ease via boat.

mountainOrRuins.Name: Mountain Or Ruins
mountainOrRuins.Description: Your nation is founded in the mountains or includes a significant ruined location, and it uses these natural or artificial features to bolster defense. Your citizens tend to be hale and hardy, if not stubborn to a fault.

despotism.Name: Despotism
despotism.Description: Your nation's rule is centered around a single individual who seized or inherited command and whose authority is absolute. The ruler of this kingdom still retains advisors and assistants, but only when they obey the ruler's whims.

feudalism.Name: Feudalism
feudalism.Description: Your nation's rule is vested in a dynastic royal family, though much of the real power is distributed among their vassals and fiefdoms.

oligarchy.Name: Oligarchy
oligarchy.Description: Your nation's rule is determined by a council of influential leaders who make decisions for all others.

republic.Name: Republic
republic.Description: Your nation draws its leadership from its own citizens. Elected representatives meet in parliamentary bodies to guide the nation.

thaumocracy.Name: Thaumocracy
thaumocracy.Description: Your nation is governed by those most skilled in magic, using their knowledge and power to determine the best ways to rule. While the type of magic wielded by the nation's rulers can adjust its themes (or even its name—a thaumocracy run by divine spellcasters would be a theocracy, for example), the details below remain the same whether it's arcane, divine, occult, primal, or any combination of the four.

yeomanry.Name: Yeomanry
yeomanry.Description: Your nation is decentralized and relies on local leaders and citizens to handle government issues, sending representatives to each other as needed to deal with issues that concern more than one locality.

TraitDescription.cavalry: Cavalry consists of mounted combat units.
TraitDescription.infantry: Infantry consists of soldiers or creatures that move on foot.
TraitDescription.siege: Siege armies focus on the deployment of siege engines rather than personal combat.
TraitDescription.skirmisher: Skirmishers consist of a small number of highly mobile units.
